title: Does the system prevent further access to the system by initiating a session lock after a defined time period of inactivity or a user initiated session lock?
Is a device verified against a pre-defined list of authorized devices before a connection is established? (e.g., Active Directory policy or firewall rules.)
Do electronic monitoring mechanisms alert system personnel when unauthorized access or an emergency occurs?
If your authentication encryption module fails can you still authenticate without creating a denial of service that impacts operational performance of system?
Does the system authenticate devices before establishing remote network connections using bi-directional authentication between devices that are cryptographically based?
Are periodic reviews conducted of existing authorized physical and electronic access permissions to ensure they are current?
Does the system enforce assigned authorizations for controlling electronic access to the system?
Are access control policies and associated access mechanisms to control access to the system?
Are unique authenticators required to be provided by vendors and manufacturers of system components?
Are users required to take, and devices implement, specific measures to safeguard authenticators?
Do the system components separate telemetry/data acquisition services from management port functionality?

Is the unauthorized release of information outside the system boundary or any unauthorized communication through the system boundary prevented when an operational failure occurs of the boundary protection mechanisms?
